thread.title: Tribune Media Considers Selling Chicago’s Iconic Tribune Tower
thread.title_full: Tribune Media Considers Selling Chicago’s Iconic Tribune Tower - WSJ

author: Nathan Becker
title: Tribune Media Considers Selling Chicago’s Iconic Tribune Tower
text:
0 COMMENTS Tribune Media Co. TRCO 1.15 % ’s real-estate subsidiary said on Thursday that it is considering the sale of Chicago’s iconic Tribune Tower.
The landmark tower, a well-known neo-Gothic building on Michigan Ave., houses the Chicago Tribune TPUB 8.60 % ’s operations among its 36 stories.
In 2014, the Tribune newspaper reported that Tribune Media had outlined broad plans potentially to triple the building’s space with residential, retail and hotel components.
Tribune Media on Thursday said it had hired a real estate firm to help explore “all transaction options with a goal of maximizing proceeds to the company while creating a compelling mixed-use destination for the city.
Tribune Real Estate President Murray McQueen said the building’s “unparalleled location and development potential” make it an enticing opportunity. He said the company expects a high level of interest.
This past summer, Tribune Media shed its publishing business, which included newspapers, such as the Los Angeles Times and the Chicago Tribune, through a spinoff. In August, the company said it swung to a loss in its latest quarter, hurt by higher expenses and a loss on debt extinguishment.
Write to Nathan Becker at nathan.becker@wsj.com
